str2: Light, a source of light, radiance. From an obsolete phao; luminousness.
A lamp. From the base of leukos; a portable lamp or other illuminator.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Prolongation for the base of phos; to lighten, i.e. Show.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
(a) of time: still, yet, even now, (b) of degree: even, further, more, in addition. Perhaps akin to etos; 'yet, ' still.
And, even, also, namely.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.
From a primary but obsolete verb nupto; a young married woman, including a betrothed girl; by implication, a son's wife.
And, even, also, namely.
A bridegroom. From numphe; a bride-groom.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A merchant, trader; one on a journey. From en and the base of poreuomai; a tradesman.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A great one, a lord; a courtier, satrap, nobleman. Plural from megistos; grandees.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To lead astray, deceive, cause to wander. From plane; to roam.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

Magic, sorcery, enchantment. From pharmakeus; medication, i.e. magic.
